intro: Paepalanthus bombacinus, commonly known as the Brazilian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in wetland areas and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. It has palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
